Package model

Class VortexCannonStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AbstractTargetStrategy
      • model.VortexCannonStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TargetStrategy 
    public class VortexCannonStrategy
extends AbstractTargetStrategy
    The following class is one of the strategies used to determine the way targets are chosen by the shooter.

    • Method Detail

      • areTargetValid

        public boolean areTargetValid​(Player shooter,
                              java.util.List<Player> targets)
        Method used to check whether or not the targets chosen by our shooter are all valid or not
        Specified by:
        areTargetValid in interface TargetStrategy
        Overrides:
        areTargetValid in class AbstractTargetStrategy
        Parameters:
        shooter - is the player whose turn is and who got to chose the target/targets
        targets - list of players chosen BY the player to check whether or not they are valid targets or not
        Returns:
        a boolean that it depends from the list of players selected by the shooter. If all valid then return true

      • canHitSomeone

        public boolean canHitSomeone​(Player shooter)
        Method needed to determine whether or not there's at least one target available for the shooter.This way we can avoid unneeded further methods to be used at
        Specified by:
        canHitSomeone in interface TargetStrategy
        Overrides:
        canHitSomeone in class AbstractTargetStrategy
        Parameters:
        shooter - is the player whose turn is
        Returns:
        a boolean that checks whether or not the getHittableTargets method is empty or not

      • getHittableTargets

        public java.util.List<Player> getHittableTargets​(Player shooter)
        Method used to return list of all hittable targets from our shooter's map position. Two conditions are needed to be met so that it gets validated: 1. Filter all the players that do have a distance minor or equal to 1 2. Remove yourself from the list that was generated in the first step
        Specified by:
        getHittableTargets in interface TargetStrategy
        Overrides:
        getHittableTargets in class AbstractTargetStrategy
        Parameters:
        shooter - is needed to check what players can he attack and obviously to remove himself from the list of possible targets
        Returns:
        all the players that can be targeted by the shooter (the shooter isn't included)

      • moveTarget

        public void moveTarget​(Player shooter,
                       Player target,
                       Tile destination)
        Method used to move the picked target (after verifying that the player is a valid target and destination is a valid action also.
        Parameters:
        shooter - needless to say, is the one who picks the target and target's new destination
        target - is the player who is being targeted by the shooter and whose destination will change
        destination - is the new Tile where the target will get moved into

      • areTargetValidBlackHole

        public boolean areTargetValidBlackHole​(Player shooter,
                                       java.util.List<Player> targets)
        This method is used in case the player wants to apply the optional effect also, Black Hole. Once the basic effect has been applied, it checks if the new list of targets is available or not.
        Parameters:
        shooter - is the player whose turn is and who gets to choose the target/targets
        targets - is the list of targets picked by the player. This doesn't mean all the targets should be valid
        Returns:
        true or false based on the list of targets chosen by the player. If all the targets are valid targets, then return true, else false

      • canHitSomeoneBlackHole

        public boolean canHitSomeoneBlackHole​(Player shooter)
        Method used for the optional effect, Black Hole. It checks whether or not the player, after performing the basic effect, can perform or not the optional one also based on whether or not there is at list one possible target
        Parameters:
        shooter - is the player whose turn is
        Returns:
        true or false by checking whether or not the hittableTargetsBlackHole is empty or not

      • hittableTargetsBlackHole

        public java.util.List<Player> hittableTargetsBlackHole​(Player shooter)
        Method needed to return the list of players that are valid targets for our player (shooter)
        Parameters:
        shooter - is the player whose turn is. It's needed to perform the action later on
        Returns:
        list of all valid targets seen by our shooter's perspective

      • blackHole

        public void blackHole​(Player shooter,
                      java.util.List<Player> targets,
                      Tile destination)
        This method is used to move the hittable targets to their new destination which would be the Tile where the Black Hole is placed at, chosen by the player
        Parameters:
        shooter - is the player whose turn is.He gets to chose the targets and also where to place the black hole
        targets - is the list of all the VALID players to whom the effect can be applied and chosen by the player
        destination - is the new destination where this/these target/targets will get placed at
